etymologies: 1930s; earliest use found in Journal of Experimental Medicine. From osteo- + dystrophy, after German Osteodystrophia

definitions: Any of a diverse group of disorders characterized by generalized or localized abnormality in the structure of bone; especially that caused by hyperparathyroidism (also called osteitis fibrosa, osteitis fibrosa cystica).

notes.text: renal osteodystrophy: osteodystrophy resulting from secondary hyperparathyroidism and abnormal vitamin D metabolism in chronic renal failure.
